Name: Ile-de-France
Description: The capital region, home to Paris, known for its historical landmarks, cultural institutions, and economic importance.

Name: Provence-Alpes-Cote d Azur
Description: A southern region known for its Mediterranean coastline, lavender fields, and tourist destinations like Nice and Marseille.

Name: Auvergne-Rhone-Alpes
Description: A mountainous region featuring the Alps, known for outdoor sports, the city of Lyon, and a thriving wine industry.

Name: Brittany
Description: A region located in the northwest of France, known for its Celtic heritage, rugged coastline, and unique culture.

Name: Normandy
Description: A historic region known for its D-Day beaches, Camembert cheese, and scenic countryside.

Name: Grand Est
Description: A northeastern region known for its wine, including the Champagne region, and historical cities like Strasbourg and Metz.

Name: Hauts-de-France
Description: A northern region, bordering Belgium, known for its industrial history, the city of Lille, and World War I memorials.

Name: Occitanie
Description: A southern region known for its Mediterranean coastline, the Pyrenees mountains, and cities like Toulouse and Montpellier.

Name: Nouvelle-Aquitaine
Description: A southwestern region, known for its vineyards, including Bordeaux, and its long Atlantic coastline.

Name: Pays de la Loire
Description: A region on the western coast, known for its maritime culture, Nantes, and the Loire Valley s castles.

Name: Centre-Val de Loire
Description: A central region famous for its châteaux, including Château de Chambord, and its location along the Loire River.

Name: Corsica
Description: An island region in the Mediterranean known for its mountainous terrain, Mediterranean beaches, and unique culture.

Name: Bourgogne-Franche-Comté
Description: A region famous for its wine, Dijon mustard, and rich historical heritage, including castles and medieval towns.
